info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:28PM EDT until May 16 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR WESTERN LINCOLN...CENTRAL CLEVELAND AND NORTHWESTERN GASTON COUNTIES... At 627 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles southwest of Lincolnton, or near Cherryville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lincolnton, Cherryville, Bessemer City, Belwood, Lawndale, Fallston, Waco, Boger City, Crouse and Vale. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
